alert.note: Alert for Winona (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 15 at 8:21PM CST until December 15 at 9:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CST FOR CENTRAL WINONA...SOUTHEASTERN BUFFALO AND TREMPEALEAU COUNTIES... At 820 PM CST, a severe squall line capable of producing both tornadoes and extensive straight line wind damage was located near Winona, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. These dangerous storms will be near... Arcadia around 830 PM CST. Whitehall and Independence around 840 PM CST. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Merrick State Park, Lock And Dam 5 A, Dodge, Beach Corners, Perrot State Park, Chimney Rock and Tamarack. This includes Interstate 90 in Minnesota between mile markers 263 and 267. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
